genzo - (24/06/2009 11:26): hi everyone  
genzo - (24/06/2009 11:27): how can i modify the core system of xwiki ? the documentation is a bit ambigous about that  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:03): no one ?  
asyd - (24/06/2009 12:05): define "modify the core" ?  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:06): i'd like to enhance for my own purpose the xwiki class editor  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:06): by adding a "remove property" functionality  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:07): thus i have to write some code into class editor files  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:08): but i don't know where i can find those files  
genzo - (24/06/2009 12:19): i hope i've made myself clear !  
arunreddy - (24/06/2009 12:22): genzo: You can start builiding from the source.

arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:09): anamarias : Hi  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:10): Have you used any classes in shared-tests to test components.?  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:11): hi arunreddy\_   
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:11): anamarias : the other day you had some discussion with sergiu.. I need some help.  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:12): i'm working on it right now. i'm trying to use XWiki.XWikiUsers  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:12): yes, that's right, but i still have that problem (it doesn't build)  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:12): Extend AbstractXWikiComponentTestCase, and accessing the component with getComponentManager() ??   
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:13): Ok  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:13): for the test case yes, i extended AbstractXWikiComponentTestCase  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:14): and getComponentManager() for getting the mock DocumentAccessBridge  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 18:16): Ok thanks a lot.  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 18:17): sure, np  
cristinas left at 18:19 ("Leaving")  
lucaa left at 18:22 ("Leaving.")  
jvelociter left at 18:37 ()  
KermitTheFragger left at 18:38 ("Leaving")  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 19:06  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 19:08  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:14  
venkatesh left #xwiki at 19:28  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:29): sdumitriu : Hi  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:30): Hi arunreddy\_  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:30): i would like to start working on the wizard. Using velocity and JS.   
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:30): Sorry no feedback yet  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:30): I've been busy with school stuff  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:30): Its ok.. Looks like you are busy these days  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:30): School ?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:31): PhD  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:31): Oh great. All the best.  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:32): Thanks  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:32): i have few questions if you are free.  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:32): How is the form stuff handled in XWiki.   
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:32): Posting content .. Ajax and velocity.  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:33): WDYM?  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:34): something like when i try to upload something its posted to  : xwiki/bin/upload/-----  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:34): xwiki/bin/import/<path to page am using>  
tmortagne left at 19:34 ("Ex-Chat")  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:35): Am i understandable ?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:35): No  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:35): What exactly do you want to know?  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:36): i wanted to know how to handle forms, and make calls to components based on that and retrieve data ..  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:36): basically to desing a wizard kind of approach.   
arkub left at 19:37 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:37): I have been through few existing ones like Preferences ..  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:39): Is it possible to use Ajax ( Prototype / GWT ) to design one. If so some reading or links which may be of some use to me.  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 19:40): arunreddy\_: do you want to use a component's services from the client side ?  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:41): yes,   
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:42): sdumitriu : Am i understandable now.?  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:42): anamarias : yes from the client side using velocity and js, making it more interactive.  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:47): arunreddy\_: You should write the code inside a wiki document  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:48): Ok  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:48): JS inside jsx objects  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:48): CSS inside ssx objects  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:48): The velocity inside the document content  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:49): can jsx objects make calls to components.?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:49): No  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:49): js is in the browser, components are on the server  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:49): This means that you need to expose component behavior in velocity  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:50): You do this using a velocity context initializer  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:50): yeah i have done that in my app.  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:50): Which puts a handle to your component inside the velocity context  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:50): You then call its methods from velocity scripts  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:50): And the document you write should act like a web service  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:51): Meaning that based on the requested URL (some query parameters) it does different things  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:51): Then, you make AJAX requests to these special URLs from JavaScript  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:51): This way you can have a connection between JS and Java  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:52): Thats what i need.  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:55): The documents you are speaking about - Are they normal XWiki documents?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 19:56): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:57): And one more to connect to the database and make retrieve some data. Is there any existing module which i can make use of ?  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 19:58): sry its / to make some queries and retrieve data...  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 19:58): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/velocityHqlExamples  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): about one simple example there:  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #set($query="select obj.name, prop.name prop.value from BaseObject obj, StringProperty prop where obj.className='XWiki.XWikiUsers' and prop.id.id=obj.id")  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #set($results = $xwiki.search($query))  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #foreach ($item in $results)  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00):  \* $item  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #end  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): why am I not getting any results back ?  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): not even for:  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #set($query1="select obj.name from BaseObject obj where obj.className='XWiki.XWikiUsers'")  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #set($results1 = $xwiki.search($query1))  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #foreach ($item in $results1)  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00):  \* $item  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:00): #end  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:01): hey i want to connect to a external database. for ex : A mediaWiki database on MySQL  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:01): not the XWiki one.  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:01): hmm, won't that be done on the server side ?  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:02): or not, sorry I don't know exactly what you need...  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:03): Task is simple.. To query the mediawiki database and generate a dump from it. we can do it normally using jdbc .   
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 20:03  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:04): arunreddy\_: You should not do that  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:04): You get the dump as an upload, don't try to connect to the database  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:04): anamarias: $xwiki.search requires programming rights  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:05): If you're on the farm, you don't have them  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:05): wdym  by getting dump as an upload ?   
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:05): I'm on a local XE  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 20:06): should the Admin be last editing the document to work ? (i was logged in as a simple user)  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:06): i think the user should have admin rights.  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:07): programming rights.  
mflorea left at 20:08 ("Leaving")  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:10): arunreddy\_: The user provides the sql dump as a file  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:10): You don't go to the database to get it  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:11): so the use case will be to dump the sql file in the local database and import from that ?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:11): No  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:11): local database -- XWiki database.  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:11): The use case is:  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:12): Johnny Boy wants to migrate from MediaWiki to XWiki  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:12): He goes to the mysql server and dumps the contents of the mediawiki database into a file, mw.sql  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:12): He starts XWiki  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:12): Goes to the Import wizard  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:13): Selects "Import from MediaWiki SQL dump"  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:13): The wizard displays an upload field  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:13): He selects mw.sql  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:13): And the importer works with this uploaded file  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:13): It doesn't even have to end up in the database  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:14): Am i supposed to parse the .sql file and generate content out of it.?  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 20:17): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:18): thats totally new. Plain regex or any existing libraries available like dom4j for XML  
arunreddy\_ - (24/06/2009 20:20): let me give it a try. :)  
sdumitriu left at 20:34 ("Leaving.")  
arunreddy\_ is now known as arunreddy|afk ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection))  
arkub joined #xwiki at 20:53  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 21:48  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:49  
vmassol left at 21:55 ()  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 22:41): sdumitriu: hi. I'm still having problems building my test case class. when you have some time to look into it, just let me know. thanks  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 22:53): Can you commit the code as it is now/  
sdumitriu - (24/06/2009 22:53): ?  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 22:53): ok  
anamarias - (24/06/2009 22:55): done
